description:
A Cable Car from North Beach is always our choice when we plan on drinking later that night, garlicky & extra greasy from the garlic sauce, loads of cheese & bacon!  I've gotten pizzas from this location twice & they've been consistent.  Parts of the crust were not a little burned like the San Mateo location the last time I went. My wife and I keep coming back.

Overall a good option in the Outer Sunset to pick up pizza to bring back home.
author: Mario V.

description:
Great place to grab a casual slice or two to take home.  Tasty pies!!!
Very pleasant staff; quick and courteous ...great neighborhood spot.
Love this place!!!
author: Craig G.

description:
I never ever ever write reviews but this was my 2nd failed attempt at delivery and need to remember not to order again. 
1st time I ordered the fettuccine Alfredo and it was bad. Swimming in cheese and sauce to the point where I had to dump it out. Buffalo chicken was added as well as random veggies but I chalked this fail to personal taste. 

Today I ordered the lasagna. 
It seemed like a big portion but is actually swimming in sauce. Literally swimming to the point where if u try to use a fork to eat it, u cannot cut a piece since everything is just free floating around. It came hot but lasagna noodles were room temp so I guess sauce was just heated up n poured on top. 

What a waste of $$
Wings are okay though not gonna lie
author: Alma A.

description: Honestly just not a fan of the taste. I literally would say you're better off eating from a Dominoes or a frozen pizza. Crust isn't very good, the ham they used was just huge slices of deli ham, and the cheese was just...ugh. It looks like some people like it, so it might be worth a shot if you haven't had it, but for me, HARD pass.
author: Sahil P.

description:
Have ordered from this location through DoorDash on multiple occasions. For those busy days where we can't seem to find time to cook dinner. Very happy that it usually takes no more than 40 minutes from order to delivery on a week night. I imagine weekends can take a little longer.

As for the pizza, we usually order a medium half Hawaiian / half meat lovers. The first time they got it right, but the second time they combined the two. It still tasted good, so I'm not complaining. I believe it's more of an issue of ordering through the DoorDash app that made the confusion. Disclaimer: the DoorDash app doesn't make it easy to choose 1/2 options. 

Anyways the pizza, itself was good. Yes, the crust is thick and it is greasy. Yes, you can find higher quality pizza elsewhere. But for the speed of delivery, this isn't bad and I will still continue to order from here for delivery.
author: Lauren P.

description: Love this place my 2 kids& I enjoy thd pizza. The employees are very nice. Service is very good. When you need a yummy quick dinner for & the kids. Stop in have a slice.
author: Karen B.

description: I wanted a quick slice and this place certainly delivered. I was in and out in less than 10 minutes! Would I come back? Sure. Is the pizza tasty? It was good but nothing really memorable.
author: Sam Y.

description: Laid up in the hospital in San Francisco family coming to see me I ordered a pizza from North Beach Pizza and garlic bread and it was fabulous I would definitely recommend going there if you like pizza and they delivered it right to my hospital room
author: Kris W.

description: The Golden gate bridge pizza is my favorite due to the pesto sauce. They have another pizza with tomatoes and bacon and that one is good too. Their bread and crust aren't too crunchy or soft. We always order the big pizzas so we can have leftovers. My family and I have been ordering pizza from here for years, and it has always been pretty consistent. The pizza has remained tasty and delicious. I always come back for the pesto.
author: Allyson L.

description: I really loved this pizza!!!! Fast delivery too. The cheese is high-quality and plentiful, and the crust is robust and fluffy with a slight crisp. Not overly saucy or messy. A perfect pie. Toppings were fresh/good too.
author: Joshua D.

description:
I usually love this place but my last encounter was not up to par. It started with the lady who answered the phone, she was very short and before I could finish my order she would cut me off to see if I wanted anything else. If she let me talk she would of heard my order the first time. After I ordered my food she just hung up, I had to call back to see if we were disconnected. 
The delivery was fast and the man was polite. 
Unfortunately the good was a disappointment. I ordered the thin crust margarita, it was not thin crust, more like regular crust at most pizza places. I also ordered "plain" chicken wings but they were not plain they had a slightly spicy sauce on them. I called to make sure I had received the "plain" and was told that the ones with the sauce on the side was what they called "plain". 
Anyway not that great, very disappointed, wasted $30.
author: Audra H.

description: This little place has the best pizza slices in town!! They are huge, yummy and only $3! We always pick up slices when we go to the beach a few blocks away.
author: Staci C.

description: This is not a 'dine-in' location. They have a window bar with a couple bar stools in a area the size of a closet. Our family walked to here in a light rain for lunch...only to find no where to dine in, sit down and eat. This is a carry out location and should advertise as such. Food may be great but I'll never know. I don't normally give bad reviews but this was an extremely frustrating experience.
author: Greg B.

description: Was craving some garlic bread and ended up getting the garlic cheese bread from here to go. Got two half loaves of garlicky, cheesy bread, sliced so you could easily tear a nice piece off. It had good flavor, though texture wise it would have been nice to have a more crunchy crust to accompany the soft interior. Would have given it 3 stars but OMG THE MARINARA. It was so unexpectedly good, and I literally drank what was leftover.
author: Max P.

description: Got a great pizza here last Sat. Seems improved since last year. Five stars for this time minus one star for past experience. A few more like this and I'll add the star back in. Don't know of any better place near outer sunset. The current number of stars (3) is just wrong! They gave discount for pickup, which is nice. It was $22.55 out the door for a 16" pie with 4 toppings. Looks like they replaced their ordering website too. Previously, it would try to charge me over $2,000 for an order. Also, in the past, the charges on the printed menu in the store did not match what they actually were charging. Also, one time they were charging double for some of the toppings like anchovies. Now I believe they are all the same. Thank you.
author: Ross W.

description: I used to love this place but my last encounter was really bad. Pizza sauce was bland, and watery. Dough was hard kinda burnt. Mushrooms on top were still raw.
author: Mario L.

description: Pretty generic pizza. Super doughy crust. Sauce is sweet and cheese seems odd. Reminds me of Pizza I used to eat for lunch in middle school
author: Rex L.

description: This is my go-to pizza place in the area. I always get a cheese pizza with creamy garlic sauce and extra cheese. It's probably one of my favorite hang over cures! Reasonable price in my opinion and the workers are always friendly and on top of things.
author: David M.

description:
Haven't been here in years. Had some late night munchies the other day and wanted to grab a bite. I lived nearby and decided to grab a slice of pizza.

$4 for a HUGE slice of pizza. Taste was good and was ready in minutes. Will def come back if need a quick bite.
author: Raymond C.

description: The pizza just... didn't taste like anything. The marinara sauce seemed watered down, the sausage,bacon and pepperoni all had the same lack of taste and texture. Ditto the chicken wings. Overall it was barely better than Tombstone or DiGiorno. Definitely not worth the money.
author: Graham H.

description:
I love this place.  They are fast and courteous and the food is delicious!  I love the North Beach Pizza and their sauce is amazing.  
I order a couple times a month and have never been disappointed.  
THANKS GUYS!
author: Tanner O.

description: An hour and ten min for delivery... and arrived cold. Pizza has seriously gone downhill in Parkside.
author: Paul Z.

description: Pizza was fast, cheap, and delicious. It took 15mjns for a Extra Large Pizza and wings. I was delighted with it
author: Angel J.

description:
Decent pizza on Taraval St. In the Sunset District! What more can you ask for?

I live about 2 blocks away and I always come here cause the staff is nice and it's close to my house. Slices starts around $3 - $3.50. I tried their Aloha Special and it was pretty good!

Not the best pizza in town but satisfies any pizza cravings!
author: Daniel S.

description: I live a 3 to 4-minute drive away from the North Beach Pizza branch on Grant & Union. I love their pizzas. I ordered a small Coit 2 hours+ ago, and only now did it arrive. They said it could take an hour. This time, the pizza did not taste well. I go by North Beach Pizza almost every day. They are not that busy. North Beach Pizza is a sinking ship. Their service sucks. Worst in San Francisco - true, although sad to observe.
author: Peder F.

description: This was an ok, pizza place. Not amazing, not bad, just ok, and sometimes on a Saturday night after drinking wine all day, ok pizza just hits the spot! North Beach Pizza is one of those pizza places that you can order pizza by the slice or order a full pie. There is no seating area aside from a bar that can sit maybe five people, which was fine for our group, but something to keep in mind. The staff were friendly and were very business-forward. There is no parking, aside from street parking, so if you're new to the San Fran area, you may have to drive around to find parking. In general, if I was spending another Saturday drinking all day, I would come back.
author: Anna L.

description: We were desperate for a late dinner after traveling all day with our kids. We were staying at an Airbnb in the area so we looked on Yelp to find someplace that would deliver late Friday night. North Beach was friendly on the phone and got our order right. The delivery was quicker than promised. The pizza itself was pretty mediocre, but it filled our bellies at the end of a long day so we were thankful for the prompt service.
author: Lisa Marie M.

description: The owner was amazing. Late night order just about to close and I ended up ordering from the wrong location. They were very welcoming and acted like there was no issues. Great business great service.
author: Jason V.

description: My family and I had just come home from traveling out of the country for two weeks, and my sister and I were in desperate need of some cheesy pizza. She had raved about going here during high school a lot, so we ordered for pick up. It took like 15-20 minutes and was able to perfectly fulfill out late night craving. Also the crust and toppings were super fresh, I can't wait to go back!
author: Angela D.

description: Nice service on the phone, and fast delivery service, as well. Good food and prices. Two thumbs up. Keep it up, guys :-)
author: Lyon B.

description: Man. Ordered delivery like I normally do and after an hour of waiting with zero updates, I thought I should call the restaurant. I did and they did not receive my order. The man I spoke with (and this is why I am giving 3 stars) continued to cut me off while I tried to provide him with more information as to where the order should be going. He said, "Let me call my driver and I'll call you back" to which I replied, "Do you have my number?" He repeats a phone number to me which is not mine. I then ask him, "Do you know the address it should be going to?" To which he replies an address that is not mine. The three stars is for not verifying the information, not offering any sort of apology (I understand there's not much you can do when an order does not reach your establishment from a third party) but most importantly he was impatient with me and I remained generally pretty calm until he scoffed at the end of our conversation when I asked him to clarify who I should be contacting to sort this out. (Oddly enough it says if there is a problem with your order to contact the establishment directly) I am all for waiting longer to have order be fulfilled but I am not okay with not be treated as a valued customer. I do hope the next person this happens to will have a better customer service experience than I did. Luckily, Grub Hub was super helpful and kind, they offered to resend the order, and notify me when the restaurant received my order. TIP: Call the restaurant as soon as you place the order to confirm they have received it! :)
author: Desiree J.

description: I was concerned about the price of a slice of pizza and some bread being over $10, but it is so amazing, its totally worth it beautiful and delicious, this is a new favorite for me!
author: Matt T.

description: Ordered the Veggie Lasagna. I've had it before and it was good enough that I ordered it again tonight. Tonight was a totally different story. It's gross. Inedible. Only a small layer of cheese on the top. Big chunks of undercooked eggplant inside. Super watery sauce that looks more like dirty dishwater than sauce. Just not good. Absolutely will not order from here again. Ever.
author: Melissa S.

description: It's not bad, but it could be better. Over the years we've ordered a lot because it's so close but it seems like they have been under cooking the pizza. I don't know if they're rushed or think people like it that way but I think we'll just do frozen instead. Plus they charge a delivery fee.
author: G C.

description: The only time I've ever gone here I ordered one slice of pizza and it was undercooked. The crust was really doughy and I couldn't finish it. That was enough for me not to bother trying it again. This is unfortunate because I live between this and Brothers Pizza and I had a bad experience there too. This area is in desperate need for better restaurants.
author: Tony P.

description:
XL - North Beach Special - $28 even after a $3 off coupon. Totally not worth that price. Their pizza isn't that amazing to cost that much. I used to like this place.

Unfortunately I won't be going back due to cost vs. value. I'll be patronizing Paxti's or Brother's pizza for that same price.
author: Dylan L.

description:
We always get the Vegetarian pizza with an additional salami  or pepperoni topping.
It's not exactly the best pizza around, but it's decent. Good for times when we are too lazy to go too far.
The taste is good, but I feel it gets a little too moist/undercooked in the middle and the crust is not as crispy as I like it.
author: Eileen N.

description: They used to be so good, but now they are ok. Their pizza used to have a lot of sauce and that makes it so tasty with heavy flavor. It is a little bit dry now. Please bring back the good taste.
author: Tony Z.

description:
Alright so huge slices of pizza for $3-4 bucks a pop, not bad!

My first experience of North Beach Pizza came on a drunken night. I shared a slice of the cheese pizza and it was great, in fact it was fantastic. Maybe it was the fact that pizza when drunk is one of the best things ever, in fact, it had a lot to do with it.

My second experience came on a Monday night after work, wanting a not-too-heavy dinner before a workout. They have a good menu with different options, from create your own, to signature pizzas. The only thing is, if you want anything more than cheese or pepperoni as a slice, they just add the toppings on to the slices. It's not authentically made, if that makes sense.

The guy explained this to me beforehand, and I was fine with it since I didn't want a whole pizza. I decided to go with a create your own and got mushroom and artichoke hearts. The slices are big. Though the taste wasn't great, they have a lot of seasonings that you can add to enhance flavor - pepper flakes, parmesen, oregano (I think) and even tapatio!

It was my first time having tapatio on a pizza, but damn that sh*t is good!

The pizza slice alone wasn't great. It probably has a lot to do with them just popping the mushroom and artichoke hearts on top of the pizza instead of making it together with the cheese and sauce. But I can see myself frequenting North Beach Pizza because of convenience and affordability.

Next time though, I might stick to simpler ingredients, or maybe even cheese or pepperoni.
author: Junel S.

description:
It's not the best pizza in town, but it is fresh and they give a lot for the price. 
Sometimes better than other times, depends who's working.
author: Kevin K.

description: For 3 dollars their  slices of cheese pizza are a good deal.  A little doughy but large with lots of sauce and cheese.  Good taste and  nice guys.
author: Mark P.

description: It's okay please nothing special about it Brothers Pizza down the block it's 10 times better I came there one time after work order the slice I wasn't satisfied
author: Jonathan S.

description: To begin wirh I was greeted with really awesome customer service. This person was no afraid to offer some advise on the menu and apologize for misunderstanding me over the poor phone connection. The food arrived very quickly (about 20 minutes) and piping hot. I was very happy to find out the gentleman on the phone gave me sound advice on what to order. I will DEFFINETLY be a repeat customer.
author: Christopher C.

description: One of the best pizza places in San Francisco. Had an early lunch there today. I was not in the mood for a pork bun or Chinese food and decided to get a slice of cheese and a soda...4 bucks! Can't beat that price. The pizza slice itself was pretty huge and was piping hot. I burnt my tongue but that's okay it 'twas my fault. The service was extremely fast and I thought that everything tasted fresh. One of my favorite pizza places.
author: Julian F.

description: I like a saucy, cheeesey slice of pizza, and that is exactly what you can expect here.  The guys working here are really friendly and always seem to be having a good time.  Can't ask for much better on a cold, foggy night in the Sunset when you don't feel like cooking at home.
author: Emily M.

description: Thin crust, extra crispy... BOOM! Or anytime you want to make it a pizza night, definitely recommend a slice of cheese -grab and go (they'll heat to up!). The group that runs it are tight, enjoy the conversation, everyone is friendly and will give you exactly what you ask for. Hidden gem, if you let it be so.
author: Emily J.

description: super cheap! considered to all other places in sf. they take care of people and also my order came in 40 minutes so that was nice. they're fast and cute also the pizza is a bit on the greasy side and the crust is pretty standard. i like it
author: Xavier L.

description: For some reason, every time I order pizza from the location on Grant by my work, it's delivered hot and delicious!  So any time I want pizza, I remember this and decide to order from North Beach.  But for some reason, this location doesn't deliver the yummy pizza I remember eating at work.  It's not very hot and doesn't have that ooey gooey cheesy goodness I'm craving.  But in general, I do like the specialty pizzas they offer.  The Coit Special and the Golden Gate Special are my favs!  I'll probably order from here again since I like ordering a tomato based pizza and a pesto based pizza and North Beach offers both, but hopefully I'll get that pizza satisfaction I remember every time I order from my work location.
author: Elena N.

description: I love pizza . I work in San Francisco and don't have a lot of time to sit down and do the whole dining experience so I always get pizza by the slices . I really like north beach pizza for slices compared to other places . It's cheap 3 dollars for a cheese and 3.50 for a pepperoni an they're delicious . They don't taste old and cardboardy like some other places . This location is not like the other ones that I've been to ,This is not a restaurant , they have a standing counter but you should not plan on having dinner here because they're really small and this location is set up to just make and deliver the pizzas .
author: Toan T.

description: I order from this place every Saturday. I like my pizza thin crust and that's what I always ordered. I'm not going to order from this place anymore. Yesterday I ordered thin crust again and it was not thin crust. So far, they only gave me thin crust 3 times out of the over 20 times I have ordered. I'm sic of trying to explain to them a simple request. I'll just stop buying from this place. Lost a customer for life.
author: Cuong P.

description:
One of our go-to pizza delivery spots. I live in the outer Richmond and there isn't a lot of decent pizza spots that will deliver that far out. They've always been on time or earlier, which is great because we're already starving when we order the pizza...

Our delivery app choice is usually GrubHub, they have freebies sometimes, and they guarantee satisfaction.

My boyfriend is super simple, so we usually just get the meal deal. It's about $22 for a liter soda of your choice, ten wings, and a single topping pizza. You can add extra toppings for $1-3 each depending what it is. 

The pizza isn't greasy and the wings are extra spicy, and we love it!
author: Mindy T.

description:
This is Specific to the Taraval location. Ordered delivery, the spaghetti has no sauce, the other pasta is mostly oil and under-cooked. The delivery driver came to the door, took the cash and  told us that the sauce had leaked out of something as he was headed down the stairs.

This is the WORST pizza place in town, please try something like Firehouse or even Extreme, all will be better.
author: brian s.

description: What a f....ing dump. Went at lunch time on a Sunday at 1:00 for a couple slices. All they had was one miserable looking slice of cheese. The lady said she would have some more in 25 minutes. Yeah right! Who's going to wait 25 minutes for a slice of pizza.  Never going to north beach pizza again. Went to the Chinese restaurant next door instead.
author: Chris V.

description: Delicious slices, the spaghetti and meatballs is done well but not always consistent, sometimes the sauce is thick and other times it is really thin with a lot of tomatoes. That would be my only complaint. But it is very tasty. 4 stars.
author: Bella B.

description: Impersonal service leads to scorched slice.  Last effort here. Will serve you a slice from the heater without asking for oven time.  Too bad.
author: Steve J.

description: I don't get why this place doesn't have 5 stars! I have lived few blocks away for 4 years now and I order pizza from here almost every weekend. They are tasty, always on time, reasonably priced and have really nice staff. My favorite are their thin crust pizzas which I always customize a little and they always get it right! I am supper happy with them!
author: Barbara M.

description:
NB -- what the F is going on? You used to be my go to place for a slice, but lately the quality has slipped to unbearable levels. 

Yeah, we'll still see each other and make awkward conversation -- "Oh, is that a new box? I see you still have that grease in your eyes..." -- but I just can't spend time with you if you're going to do this to yourself. Get some help, okay?

Who knows -- maybe we'll meet again when you're all better.
author: Jonathan M.

description:
Ordered from here via grubhub. Almost threw up the food was so disgusting.

We ordered two meatball subs which seems impossible to mess up.

There were barely any meatballs on it, the ones that we're were undercooked and cut in half. Oh and there was no sauce.

Don't order from this place unless you want disappointment.
author: Mandi K.

description: Gross. Crust is way too thick. Because of this, I have received pizzas that were half dough 2 out of the last 4 times. I have given up on this place. Not going back and I only like a block away. It is not worth the convenience because I know I will be wasting $20 if I go there.
author: Brett P.

description: You can smell the delicious aroma from down the block.  Which is why we get pizza here almost every Friday night.  They have delicious toppings and good prices (about $3-4) for a large slice. The Greek salad is good too. They don't have much room to eat there, so plan on this place for take out.
author: Brandi D.

description: My family LOVES North Beach Pizza! It's consistently tasty , affordable, and fast. When we travel, we always compare the pizza we may have out and about, to North Beach's. Invariably great pizza! We are loyal customers.
author: Lia W.

description:
Pretty good pizza close to the beach. Ideal for picnics or just eating around the inner sunset district. My friends and I made it a tradition to stop by here after school on the last day of school of each year of high school. Too bad high school ended, now I never get to eat this pizza anymore!

Good quality and size for the price.
author: Stephen D.

description: Ordered from them twice now and the first time they took my order, cooked it, and delivered in 20 minutes. 20. Minutes. From taking my order to food in my hand. So I ordered again today expecting the normal 45 min. But 15 min later I get a phone call: Hi I'm outside. Wtf. super fast and the pizza was nice and hot. Will probably be ordering from them often.
author: Derp D.

description: Completely adequate middle of the road pizza. It's big and greasy and kinda sloppy like something you'd get from a cafeteria. Still, if you just really need something pizza-like, the folks are friendly and the ingredient quality level is pretty high.
author: Daniel E.

description: Glad that I have this place down the street. I often come here and get a slice (or two) when I get off the L train. Its good and fast pizza. Haven't order any else on their menu besides pizza. I think for the size of the slice you're getting it isn't expensive at all.
author: Karen D.

description:
I ordered from North Beach because I frequented this pizza joint location in downtown San Mateo for many years when I lived there because it was AWESOME!

My experience with their pizza: It was absolutely SOGGY, flavorless and the ONLY thing I can give one star for is the ample amount of veggies they put on the veggie pizza.

The chicken wings were plain gross not only to look at but my husband said they tasted odd.  We will never order from them again and don't recommend anybody else to either, you can MAKE better pizza!  OR, better yet, get a safeway pizza and add some toppings if you want to go all out and you'll outdo this place!  

Truly awful.........

San Mateo location, KICK ASS!
author: Maddy B.

description:
I have order from here a few times (Taraval Location).

The guys working here aren't very friendly. I ordered a few slices of cheese and a come, an they did have it ready and hot. It tasted fresh. I went here a few days ago and waited 7 minutes before the cook had to ask me what I ordered, bc everyone else was on the phone taking orders. I know it was pretty busy and I felt bad, but usually it's proper to acknowledge a waiting customer that you will be with them shortly.
author: Zack K.

description: Felt like I should write a review on behalf of my parents. They love this pizza. They've been ordering here for years. I want to say 15 or so years! Anyway, after a few months of not getting pizza, they decided they wanted to get a pie today. When we first called, they claimed we were not in the system. Maybe they removed us cause its been so long, which is sad. They also added a delivery charge which also sucks. I ordered our pizza and when it was delivered, the order was wrong. I gave them a call to let them know, and after a few passes of the call (i was expecting them to give me the cold shoulder), they decided to give us a whole second pizza! I know this is not the norm, and I'm not sure if the quality is the same as it used to be, but this is just a honest business trying to continue making a living. The pizza was decent, but the decision to give us a whole second pizza is 5 star worthy. Thank you North Beach on Taraval!
author: Christopher L.

description:
A Cable Car from North Beach is always our choice when we plan on drinking later that night, garlicky & extra greasy from the garlic sauce, loads of cheese & bacon!  I've gotten pizzas from this location twice & they've been consistent.  Parts of the crust were not a little burned like the San Mateo location the last time I went.  I've noticed with both locations though, some of the chicken meat was drier than it used to be.  Maybe it means they've switched from dark to light meat?

Overall a good option in the Outer Sunset to pick up pizza to bring back home.
author: Cat C.

description:
Food: 1/5
Service: 5/5 cashiers only

I've only ordered slices from here so I'll review that. I ordered a pepperoni slices from here before because we didn't have enough people for a whole pie. So the pizza wasn't fresh. What they do is take the individual slices sitting out on the counter and then reheat them in the pizza oven. The ones I had were always still cold. I have to bring them home and reheat it rather than eat it there. The cheese is not melted but still hard. This is a take out place so there are only a few bar stools with a ledge you can eat on at the windows. I felt that for the price, there should be more cheese and toppings. The pizza and the cheese is pretty thin so a slice isn't much of meal.

The only good thing about this place is that it is open very late and deliver.
author: Cecile S.

description: Awesome pizza, quick service and always consistent. Great place to order pizza from when you don't feel like going out.
author: Chelsey R.

description: Placing an order online was easy but I was a bit surprised when I called to check on the readiness status that they actually took an hour to process online requests. Anyway, no complaints about their artisanal Cable Car Special and Verdi's Special. The Cable Car satisfied by my meat fix with the chicken and bacon, and the juicy tomatoes lightened overall heaviness. The Verdi's had a nice Italian selection of toppings consisting of spinach, pesto and feta cheese. Only wished their pizza sizes were bigger.
author: Cliff W.

description: Ordered a large pizza/wing/soda combo using a coupon off the Eat/24 app, and it was one of the worst $30 I spent on pizza ever. A buddy of mine works at the original North Beach Pizza that is actually in North Beach, and the pizza there is phenomenal. The pizza that I ordered on this occasion (Taraval), was less than mediocre, and to add salt to a wound, it was cold!! I ordered a large, (me & my sister were starving btw) and all we ate were 3 slices!! It was actually just gross. Will probably never order from the Taraval location again after this. Save your $. Wings sucked too, asked for extra ranch & buffalo sauce on wings, so they gave me no ranch & 2 containers of buffalo sauce.. Thanks..
author: Manuel R.

description: We love a good pizza... but we're also really picky so we love a good customizable pizza that will let us spring for chicken wings, a salad, and and tasty garlic bread. Oh, and they should deliver because LAN parties can be kind of spontaneous at times. And so, that is why we love this place. Because I can get my veggie side, everyone else can have their meaty side and they've always been great about communicating along the way.
author: Shauna S.

description: Worst service.the cashier with glasses kept FLIRTING with her boyfriend on the counter where u place the orders so he kept blocking the way.it seemed like all the girl wanted to do was make out with her boy toy.while this was happening her co workers were working hard in the back while she flirts
author: Aj M.

description:
Whenever I home from work and I'm too lazy to cook, I call them up and it's always hits the spot!!! Well, I've had better pizza but their pasta dishes are pretty great and reasonably priced plus big servings! I especially love the lasagna, enough for my boyfriend and I to share and be content. Their green salad is always really fresh and they always give me an extra container of dressing :D

They always deliver in a timely manner is which is very important to me. I don't live far from it so it's nice that they get my food to me in half the proposed time!
author: Ariele M.

description: I used to eat at North Beach Pizza all the time when i was younger but not at this location.  I used to love it.  This place was ok.  I dont know if my taste has changed or its just this place that i didnt like.  My boyfriend loved it he said it was his second favorite pizza place.
author: Andrea D.

description:
Pretty good pizza.

I would've given them more stars, but the last time we got pizza it was sour.  How the hell do you make pizza sour?  Anyway, it cost them a star.

This pizzeria is a good choice if you're in the neighborhood.  It's part of the North Beach Pizza chain, so it pretty good most of the time.  Although, the idea of getting sour pizza still haunts me.

Another reason I stuck to North Beach was my last job use to get a lot of pizza from this place.  Each time they ordered I ended up taking a pizza home.  Those were some good pizza.
Why does free pizza taste so good?

may yelp smile upon you.
author: Dan B.

description: Love the pizza here. Have ordered the cable car regularly along with many other items  that have been delicious as well. One star off for lack of consistency in proportion, especially among pasta dishes. I do love the food though and have never had a "bad" experience. Will be returning here many times in the future I am sure. Should also mention delivery is usually pretty quick.
author: Brandy B.

description:
Of course I've had a North Beach Pizza...it's pretty good.  They don't skimp on the toppings and I love that.  Gotta have my sausage! (yeah, i know, that's what she said LOL) 

But I've also had their spaghetti and it was good too.  Get it with their garlic bread or better yet, their garlic cheese bread!! =P

Orders are made over the phone and then we pick up, so never tried their delivery.  The staff is nice, and again, another nocturnal place for me since they're open late. 

Yep! I'll keep ordering from them when I'm in the area! =)
author: Ninja H.

description: Lacks so much flavor. This place doesn't even deserve to be called North Beach pizza it's gross. I've had NBP at other locations in the city and it was good. The veggie was soggy and I need to add salt which I've never ever done before to any pizza. The pepperoni was ok, just happy they didn't f*ck that up.
author: Louis C.

description:
North Beach Pizza is more about being in the North Beach district and eating pizza with friends and people watching. This place is a small little pizza parlor with a counter that sits 2 people. The drivers always double park and the pizza are loaded with so much MSG that you would need to drink 2 glasses of water per slice. 

As a delivery, North Beach is OK. As a sit in, there is no place to sit. There are better, and of course there are worse places around here.
author: M C.

description: North Beach Pizza is good and very convenient if you want delivery or take out... but there are certainly better pizza places around SF.  The "North Beach Special" had pepperoni, green peppers, mushrooms, onions, and sausage - all my favorite toppings! The large is indeed large and priced at $21.95 plus tax. I always expect the same from North Beach so props to them for consistency. They have a good solid crust, a decent amount of toppings, but there's something different about their tomato sauce that i just can't put my finger on.  It tastes a little off and I prefer Pasquale's on lower Irving if i'm looking for pizza in the Sunset district.
author: Samantha L.

description:
Damn good delivery pizza. Not cheap, but not necessarily expensive either. You get what you pay for. Quality pizza with lots of toppings.

The only pizza that was a little much for me was the Cable Car Pizza. It was delicious, but after the first slice the garlic cream sauce was a little too intense. If they lightened up on that, it would be just is delicious as the rest of their pizzas I have tried.
author: Katie S.

description:
I moved to the Outer Sunste in 2007 and lived two blocks from North Beach Pizza. The first few months we lived here I would have given the a place better rating. Then they changed recipes or something. The tomato sauce is highly acidic and salty and not a lot of tomato flavor. They also seemed to double the amount of cheese on a pizza. It never fully cooks, just melts and it's gooey, greasy and not very good. 

We stopped going there, but on the days when we were dog tired after work we would still order from them for delivery. But the quality was so poor we even stopped that. 

Even when we are feeling extremely lazy we will go out to Pizza on Noriega or on the rare occasion, order from Domino's or Pizza Hut (I dislike them both, but still prefer them over North beach)
author: joe f.

description:
This post only applies to the Taraval location...
These guys are crooks! We ordered a pizza, and it took over an hour to arrive. (We take care of our mother's home in the Sunset district, not 10 mins from them.) The pizza was wrong (wrong crust, wrong toppings) and tasted horrible, and when we called, they told us that they were putting a credit into the system for next time.
We called again this evening, and asked to use our credit. We were told that they had no record of our address or phone number. A little while later, we called from a different number and gave them our address for a delivery. The gentleman on the phone said "This number isn't the phone number we have connected to this address. Isn't your number xxx-xxx-xxxx?" That's when we said, wait a minute! We thought you had no record of our phone number or address!! He didn't know what to do with himself. and after stammering for a couple of minutes, hung up on us.
Seriously, if you are going to provide that type of customer service, you really need to shut it down, or hire new staff...It's a shame really, because the Sunset needs more good restaurants, and is willing to support businesses. It does a disservice to the other branches that bear the North Beach Pizza name!
Be warned...If they say they will give you a credit for "next time", they are most likely lying to you. We will not give them our business again....
author: Laura M.

description: Great pizza, not greasy. Great deep dish crust. Reheats perfectly for that midnight snack.
author: Rochelle C.

description:
I'd give them 4,5 stars, but that isn't an option. 
They are fast, cheap and delicious. The only place I order from when I'm hungry and too tired to cook.
author: Noemi S.

description: Very inconsistent.  Even when i tell them "well done and extra cheese " they don't do it even though I paid for extra cheese!
author: Pat Z.

description:
Food - 4/5 stars
Customer Service = -
First off, let me say this review is for CUSTOMER SERVICE at the Taraval store not for the food.
Let me start off by saying I've been a very loyal customer to North Beach Pizza for almost 30 years.  I used to live 1/2 block from the flagship store in North Beach and whenever possible I order NBP.  I have even turned in-laws who live in Daly City on to NBP and they drive all the way in to pick-up their orders.
Okay, on a lazy week night I decided to order in and went on-line to order up our "usual". A year or so ago they changed they on-line ordering option and you can not longer pay directly through the site, which is a pain, but the plus side is you can simply re-order from past deliveries.
If you're going to pay via credit card you now need to call and give them the information after you place the on-line order (the previously mentioned pain). I called, gave the guy my info and thought I was good to go.  30 or so minutes later the driver showed up and told me my credit card didn't go through.  Somewhat perturbed I grumbled up the stairs to call and ask why they didn't call me to say there was a problem.  Below is an abbreviated version of that conversation:
Me - why didn't you call to say my credit card didn't go through?
Rude Guy - I didn't want to bother you.
Me - how would that be a bother?
RG - just pay cash.
Me - I don't have cash, that's why I gave you the credit card.
RG - ok, send the food back
Me - I don't want to send the food back, I ordered for dinner!  Can we try the card again?
RG - ok, but it failed.
I gave the card numbers again to be told:
RG - it failed, you don't have any money.
Me - WHAT? The machine says I don't have any money?
RG - no, it failed. We run hundreds of cards. Yours failed, you don't have any money.
Me - would you STOP saying I don't have any money?
RG - the card failed, you don't have any money.
This went on for a few more minutes until he handed the phone over to the "Manager".  When I asked why I wasn't called when the card failed and said I was appalled at the demeanor of the guy on the phone she tried to make excuses for him saying "he said the wrong thing, people make mistakes" to which I responded if you're people aren't trained don't let them answer the phone!  I gave the "Manager" another card (same account, different debit card - see I DID have money!) and went down to collect my food and tip the driver.
I was so disturbed I called back and asked to speak to the owner and was told to call Al at the Mission Street Store.
I called Al and gave relayed my frustration and that I was ready to pull the plug on my 30-year relationship with them.  He seemed genuinely apologetic and asked for my phone number so he could 'send me a letter". I gave him my number but said I didn't want anything but for him to do something about the HORRIBLE customer service.
Ok...forward two weeks; I know I said I didn't want anything but I did think I would at least get a letter of apology from Al but alas, nothing.
Sorry NBP, another bad customer service move...it's officially over.  We're going to miss our thin crust, light sauce, light cheese, sausage, mushroom and onion pizzas.
author: Us And J.

description:
One of my favorite places for a nice greasy but good cheese pizza pie.  I love their pasta dishes too.  Their salads aren't bad either.

Delivery is good.  They're not on the cheap side, but they are worth splurging for every once in a while.  :-)

I prefer to use a fork and knife with their heavenly thick slices of pizza, btw.

Good eating!
author: Fannie S.

description:
I think three and a half stars is about right.   They are quick and the pizza is tasty, but there are still a few things that don't quite make it right.  

My first complaint is that the pizza was extraordinarily greasy.  i realize this is pizza, and you're not going to get matzoh with toppings.  I mean, there is something very sinfully satisfying about sinking your teeth into a piece of pizza, you know it isn't health food.  

That being said, this pizza was overly greasy, to the point where the pizza couldn't really support the toppings.  It made it difficult to eat.  Pizza shouldn't be THAT difficult to eat. Messy, ok.  But awkward?  No.  

The staff was extremely nice on the phone, though, and again they did deliver the pizza in under 30 mins.  Hopefully the pizza will better after a night in the fridge.
author: Adam E.

description: My husband and I are staying a night in SF and were exhausted from a day of walking around and decided to order pizza to our room. We ordered breadsticks and pepperoni pizza. I tried to order tiramisu, but they were out and it was only around 730. I was so dissapointed. Anyway, the breadsticks were extremely unimpressive and the marinara they came with seemed really watered down. Yuck. The pizza was still nice and hot, but the center was soo soggy and the flavor was not good! We ended up ripping off the tips of the slice and eating mostly crust. One good thing about this place is how fast the delivery was. If you are super hungry and in a hurry, go ahead and order and take your chances for not so tasty, soggy pizza.
author: Heather B.

description:
I want to emphasize that this review is specific to the Taraval location. I've had food from other North Beach Pizza locations and they have always been solid. 

I don't often write Yelp reviews, but tonight was one of the worst customer service experiences I have ever had with food delivery. My family just moved into  new home this weekend and we were exhausted so we ordered pizza to be delivered. Given the good experience I've had with other NBP locations I figured his was a very safe choice. I placed a relatively simple order for 3 pizzas (2 small, 1 large). While ordering the guy on the phone took his time and seemed like he was being very thorough- he was not. I should have guessed something was wrong when I had to ask him if I could give him a card number before ending the call (he never asked how I wanted to pay). 

When the driver showed up, she only had 2 pizzas and one of them was the wrong kind. I tried explaining the situation to the driver, but it took a while for her to understand what was wrong. She kept trying to get me to take the wrong order.  She took out her cell phone and made a call to the restaurant and I spoke to the man who has taken my order, Jose. When I spoke to him he seemed to not believe me that the order was wrong, but afer about  5 minute conversation he was apologizing and told me they would come back with the correct order.  We reviewed what I had ordered and he said he remembered it but it didn't match what he had in the computer. It seemed he was taking ownership of the situation (which is what you are supposed to do in a customer service situation when mistakes are made) by saying "I've been working here 20 years and I have never made this mistake before" (I now find that claim HIGHLY dubious). He also said that the combo pizza they had sent was the same price as the one that I had ordered and that we would keep the same bill and he would  not charge me for the 3rd pizza (a small cheese). This seemed a very reasonable solution and if they had just done that I would have been fine with them and certainly would not have bothered to write a Yelp review. 

About 30 minutes later the same driver came back, with the correct orders, and then she handed me a bill for the 3rd pizza. I was stunned. I explained to her what Jose had told me. Once again I end up on the phone with Jose. He had the audacity to expect me to pay after he told me it would be free and his explanation was outrageous. He said, "Yes, I told you it would be free but you have to pay because I did not charge you". No tact, no attempt to explain the situation and I felt bad for the poor driver that was stuck in he middle of it. Jose began to argue with me and I told him I was absolutely never ordering from them again at which point he finally said "OK, just keep the pizza". I had to argue with him to get him to honor his word. Really poor service  

Now, if the pizza had been as good as other North Beach Pizza locations, I again might have let this slide and chalk i up to a bad night, but OH MY- the pizza was bland, the vegetables were just huge chunks of vegetable that hadn't really been chopped and the sauce was AWFUL. The roof of my mouth is still trying to reject the acidity of it an hour later. 

The experience I had with the Taraval location tonight is not consistent with the quality of other North Beach Pizza locations, but after tonight I am more skeptical of the chain in general.
author: Jon B.

description:
This is my regular pizza place. Only a couple blocks from my house. 

My normal order - pepperonis on top, sausage and mushrooms. If you like crispy pepperoni edges, make sure to specify they put them on the top, otherwise, they put them under the cheese. I don't like that the sausage is scattered with fennel seeds cause I hate biting into them, but I do recognize that without said seeds, the sausage would lack that sausage flavor. Good food, good people here. Nothing to complain about. 

Sometimes, the crust is a little inconsistent, but it's all good! Mention you have a 3 dollar off coupon (for larges) and get that taken off your order! :D
author: Melissa C.

description:
I think this pizza can be a lot better, since I know i've tasted a lot a better pizzas. I really want to like it though since I hear North Beach Pizza is pretty good, but for now its just eh.

I had the pepperoni and sausage pizza and it was just ok.  It didnt taste that great, but thats probably because I was expecting the pizza to be real fresh, but it didnt seem to flavorful.

The portion of the slice to the price is pretty good, but I'll stick to my verdict, this place is just average.  I think i'll have to try it again to see if I had it wrong.
author: Mark L.

description:
Not sure why I haven't reviewed yet.  It's really good!

If you're no longer a broke college student looking for cheapest possible pizza, these guys make a tasty one loaded with good stuff.  Always consistent.  Definitely my go-to place in the Sunset.  Mmmm...the North Beach special...
author: Jason Y.

description:
Oh North Beach, you are so close to being perfect pizza in my eyes.

I'm a fan of North Beach Pizza for many reasons.  1)  They naturally go a little heavier on the sauce (and BONUS STAR the sauce is pretty damn delectable) 2) they naturally go a little lighter on the cheese (this is how I like it) 3) Since I live on Taraval myself their delivery times is always impecable,  Simple amazing really.

I've also had a few pasta dishes of theirs.  Mushroom penne is great, and they seriously have some of the best gnocchi I've ever tasted.  My bf also looooves their chicken ceasar salad.  Great dressing.

Iwould give them 5 stars, I order from them all the time.  But the last time I ordred i asked for mozzarella sticks (thinking this would obviously be something they would carry and unfortunately I was driving and didn't have a menu in front of me) and instead of getting fried ooozing cheese filled goodness like i had been looking forward too, I got breadsticks with cheese on them.  Fail.  Although the sticks were still damn good, they weren't what I had been fantasizing about for 35 minutes.  But when I went and checked the menu I was less upset when i saw that they infact DO NOT have mozzarella sticks like I thought.  I just wish they would have told me that when I had ordered, or asked me if i meant bread sticks?  It's all good though, I'll def be back.  Just a little hiccup in my and North Beach Pizza's blossoming relationship.
author: Chelsea C.

description: Their pizza tastes decent, but I had better. The crust tend to be on the thicker side.
author: Lisa L.

description:
I have been ordering pizza from here for the last 10 years, but after my experience with them just now I don't think I'll ever order from them again.

I placed my order at 8 over the phone, because their online service is unreliable. They said around 30-40 minutes. After an hour I called just to see if the pizza was on its way. Instead of apologizing they said that I lived far away (even though I live less then 5 minutes away) and they are coming soon. After another 30 minutes I get a phone call from the delivery  guy saying that he was 26th ave, which isn't my street I gave him the correct address and he FINALLY arrived a few minutes later. When he got to the door he yelled at ME for giving him the wrong address! First of all, don't show up over an hour late and yell at your customer. And secondly how could the address mix up possibly be my fault when my address and phone number has been in your system for years.  When I finally got to eat the long awaited pizza it was cold.

I like their pizza, but it is not good enough to put up with their crappy service.
author: Christina L.

description:
Ordered delivery from North Beach Pizza at 8:00pm last night and was so excited to eat pizza.  Unfortunately, the order taker did not mark down on the computer some of what I ordered and it arrived incorrectly.

I phoned North Beach Pizza and let them know of the error and they hummed and hawed and gave me a couple bucks credit for next time.

Another side issue is that my credit card number, in its entirety, was printed on the receipt with the expiration date...along with my address.  Seems like identity theft just waiting to happen.
author: David H.

description: this pizza place is our go to because it's close and tasty but the salads are ALWAYS a disappointment (yellowest romaine lettuce ever, every time)
author: stephanie e.

description:
Tired of commercial pizza? North beach is a grade up from that. 

I fell in love with North Beach pizza because of the unique creations of their signature pizzas. When I think of San Francisco, their pizzas describe them in my mouth. 

I applaud their services for mass delivery of pizzas and the quality. Although sometimes the crust does end up sometimes on the burnt side-its still a fantastic purchase!
author: Danielle B.

description:
Sign outside lists prices for slices of pizza: $3.00 for cheese, $3.50 for pepperoni, $4.00 for their supreme. Underneath the prices, it says "includes a can of soda." I went in, ordered a slice of pepperoni to go. Paid $4. Left my change (50 cents) in the tip can. My pizza came. I look out the window to make sure it says a can of soda is included. I say, "doesn't it come with a can of soda?"  
Guy replies, "oh, a can of soda with the slice is $4.25."
I leave, feeling cheated, without my can of soda and wishing I hadn't left any tip.

Not coming back. Pizza slice was large but pretty mediocre. I can only guess how long it was sitting in the warmer for.
author: Crystal L.

description:
I just ordered a large pizza from this location.

It was the worst pizza I have ever received from North Beach Pizza, it was dry with little to none sauce and hardly any cheese.  I wasted 20.00 on a piece of dough.

Do not order from this location the pizza is awful!!!!!!  It ruined or dinner and we have half of it left because no one wanted anymore. 

Order from Stanyan if you want pizza, this place should change it's name because I have always enjoyed North Beach Pizza for the last 10 years.

I wish I would have read the previous reviews before I ordered from this location.

Disappointed customer!
author: susan k.

description:
Hai world! First timer ordering delivery from here. I got the clams with garlic and thin crust pizza online. Arrived here at the house pretty quickly and tasted pretty good, especially the crust! YUM! May have to order from here another time. Peace out homies.


**lol this was not by me.
author: kim w.

description:
Pretty cool people working here.  Great pizza.  The North Beach Special is great.

I will probably have a heart attack from eating food like this, though.
author: Blake C.

description: I was going to try a new pizza place just for the hell of it since I rarely order pizza. Seniores didn't even answer the phone. Mozarela Bufala said delivery would be at least an hour. North Beach answered the phone promptly and courteously. Twenty minutes for delivery on a Saturday night. Excellent. Hot and fresh.
author: Joe F.

description:
Thank Goodness for North Beach Pizza. On election night, I could not tear myself away from CNN to make dinner. When I used to work at an Italian Restaurant in High School, it would take 12 minutes to bake a pizza. Riveted by the election I ordered a North Beach Pizza and swear that 15 minutes later my door bell rang. 

Sausage, mushroom and black olives. Unlike the other reviewers I did not find it greasy at all. The sauce is pretty good, I would say basic. 

The crust is kind of doughy and thick but not Chicago thick. Reasonably priced, hot, fast and local.
author: Amanda L.

description:
Feeling lazy and mighty hungry on a Friday night, I love the fact that I can just order pizza online and presto, change-o, the pizza is delivered to my door.
The crust is always good, not too thick, not too thin. Just like a west coast pizza should be. We customized our pizza with extra sauce, ground beef, pineapple, and bell peppers (weird combination, I know...but preggers always crave the craziest combinations). The combination was great and the taste kept pulling me back for more.
Always a reliable place to get pizza. There may be a number of North Beach Pizza places in the city, but when you're ordering on their website, they tell you which one serves your area.
Thanks again for filling my belly with some good ol' pizza.
author: Jan Z.

description:
Throwing a party need pizza? Why not pre-order some pizza from North Beach. 

Not only did they give me a deal, they tossed in some free soda too, and called me when I was 10mins late to make sure I was on my way because my pizza's were ready.

Thanks for helping make the party great!!
author: Ariona E.

description:
I have a confession to make - I don't like pizza. I know, I know. That's like letting the terrorists win. But for reals, it's not something I seek out or anything and usually only end up eating it when my boys call for takeout it or I'm drunk at 3am. 

But for the past few months I've been eating the single slices here with jalapenos, italian sausage, and mushrooms (the trick is to ask for extra sauce). My friends have caught me hiding pizza boxes in the recycling exclaiming "I THOUGHT YOU DIDN'T LIKE PIZZA. LIAR". 

Anyway for the first time the other day I experienced bad service, got bad pizza so I called when I got home. They apologized and offered to hook me up when I came back. Today I went in to claim my replacement slice and was told they had no record of my complaint. Eventually giving in, they fixed up my slice and I was all set to rip them a new one but it was just so damn good. Can't hate when this is srsly the only pizza I will eat.  

I know there are better pizzas out there... but i like this one! and it's three blocks away.
author: dr S.

description:
My favorite pizza comes from here!  LOVE IT!!!

For my fiance and I would usually order a medium pizza with sausage, mushrooms, spinach, black olives and zucchini and that way we could have left overs.  It's so freakin' yummy that I would kill to not be on a diet for my wedding right now have a slice!  

I swear that when I would call in to order and give them my number, that the guys working there totally knew that I was going to order the same pizza that I always order.  

Moving to LA, this was the one thing (besides friends and family) that I knew I would miss the most!  I can't wait for after my wedding because I'm totally going to order a pizza from them!

One small problem with the pizza I normally order...it comes with a lot of water and  some oil sitting on top of it because there's so many vegetables on it.  I always take paper towels to it before a slice is taken, otherwise the crust gets soggy.  Sometimes in the delivery car, it shifts too much and gets soggy.  The soggiest pieces are best as left overs because the bread dries and when microwaved keeps the bread from getting hard. :)

LOVE!!!!!
author: Chiara M.

description:
PUFFY, YET THIN CRUST. Mmmmmmmm.

Chicken pesto pizza, oh how much I love you.

But maybe you guys wanna cut the pizza next time so the cheese isn't dripping all over? Thanks.

And $18.50 for just a medium?! 

But still, thick, doughy, thin chicken pesto. GET IT.
author: Steph W.

description:
i'm impressed! i'm a very finicky eater with a lot of high maintenance dietary needs and north beach pizza totally accommodated all of my crazy specifications! (like extra extra light cheese on my pizza, and very light butter on the garlic bread).

besides that attention to detail and accuracy, they were also timely with delivery and delicious, using quality ingredients. Rizende who works for them was awesome- very professional, friendly, and helpful.

it's rare that i find establishments that are able to cater to my needs this well. :)
author: Tornado G.

description: Over this past weekend I was at a family event on ocean beach. It was about 10pm and fairly crowded at the beach which I was thinking fit was going to be difficult to locate me or locate the delivery. Since they were good at directions it wasn't difficult at all, which as anyone who orders delivery knows this isn't always the case. I ordered the golden gate bridge pizza(pesto chicken garlic onion). The wait was moderate(30min roughly)As I walked to my group through a crowd of other beach goers I got a few compliments on the smell. Always I good sign and when I opened the box I wasn't disappointed. Fresh doughy crust(how I like it) and the chunks of chicken were chunky. Not the cheapest pizza out there, they have a dominos a few blocks away but who wants to eat cardboard. My strongest suggestion is that the driver should ALWAYS have a ton of parmesan and peppers, I mean you work at a pizza parlor!!
author: Travis R.

description: Bad pizzas I hate them no good for vegetarians.. Less pizza more salt n MSG ...
author: Chan M.

description: This is our new pizza delivery place of choice.  After reading Jan Z.'s  review (she knows her stuff!)  MCM and I gave this place a shot on a cold rainy afternoon.  We ordered the Cable Car pizza and it arrived hot and delicious in a little less than 40 mins.  Yay!  We've tried a number of pizza delivery place over the years and all have been pretty lackluster.
author: Julienne G.

description:
Back in the day when I was attending that oh so hated on high school blocks away from this lovely pizzeria, I'd walk past by it on my way to the walgreens nearby.

I never really gave this place a chance to begin with. The place is small, no where to actually eat comfortably, so i said, nah.

Then the NB hype caught up to me... And i'm glad it did. I sit here wondering, why does Taraval St. Have such good places to eat. their pizza is soooo good. They have one of the best thick crust pizzas out there (actually probably THE best). their cheese pizzas seem to the cheesier, their pepperonis are piled on, and their chicken pesto (without red sauce, mind you) just blows you outta the world. Least to say is NB became a regular part of my diet when I went to summer school to get a head start. Too bad their prices are kind up there, cuz if it wasn't, i wouldve eaten this almost everyday. But yeah, go try some.

Oh, and dont try to eat in the store... just get it delivered. totally worth the tip.
author: Gabe R.

description:
I use to get pizza delivered from North Beach Pizza for dinner 4 years ago, when my mom was too lazy to cook.

It was always too oily, soaking through the box. The pizza wasn't too bad though.

One time, the delivery car broke down right in my drive way. It was way embarrassing. I felt sorry for the guy because he attempted to fix the car for so long. When we were done with the pizza, he was still out there! My mom told us to ask him if he needed help, but that would be awkward. He finally pushed the car out and parked it there overnight.

That was the last time we ordered from North Beach Pizza.
author: Winnie L.

description:
This review will be on the actual food because I've never been here before. So like most nights, my friends and I got hungry. This time, however, we were lazy and it was raining and we didn't want to go out because of said reasons. So it was a choice between pizza and chinese, which what it always comes down to when choosing delivery. Pizza won out (duh.)

I've ordered from this particular North Beach Pizza at least three times. I have to say, I love their New Mission Special. The whole BBQ sauce, chicken, bacon, etc. combo is great. I'm not too fond of the combo with the cheesy garlic sauce... for some reason, that's way too messy and just doesn't do it for me.

The New Mission alone gets four stars for this place. I would order other combos or other pizzas with different toppings, but I'm afraid with my friends, the New Mission will win hands down.

The free chicken wings when you order a large pizza with three toppings or more definitely helps out as well... especially since I don't eat it and lets me have more pizza when others are munching on the wings.
author: Chris S.

description:
I was hungry for pizza during a typical Saturday lunch period and I thought about trying North Beach Pizza after learning there was one sitting not too far away from home.

I ordered a slice of combo, which was made with fresh ingredients on an existing slice of cheese pizza. Good thing or not, it's up to you, but I can't complain when the toppings are stacked high and the amount of each ingredient is generous. The slice itself is about a third of an average large pie, which measures at 16"? 

It's a simple pizzeria without much seating for you and your buddies, so take-out is recommended. Overall, good quality for the price.
author: Jeremy L.

description: i had a pepperoni slice from here the other day. the pepperoni tasted like thinly sliced plastic, the dough was tough, not chewy, and it was too thick to be thin and too thin to be pan. never again.
author: Janet R.

description: I have been to several North Beach Pizza Restaurants in the San Francisco area before and I have eaten their awesome pizza's so many times in the past.... For me this is the first time that I have been to this North Beach Pizza at 3054 Taraval Street... This time I did not order any pizza instead, I went to order something different my choice of ordering was the Meat Ball Parmigiana Sandwich which tasted so gooddddd!!!!!!! That, I almost fell off my chair while eating this sandwich just kidding that didnt happen!!! But I have to say that  it was my very first time that... I have ever eaten a Meat Ball Parmigiana Sandwich at this North Beach Pizza... After so many many years of eating pizza's at the North Beach Pizza it was time for a change of eating something different at a North Beach Pizza Restaurant!!!!!
author: William B.

description:
Delivery for a $18.50 medium!

 3 Hours later, still full.  

Thanks chicken pesto pizza. You're extremely cheesy, doughy and soft, and a little bit on the puffy side. I wish you were cut a little better though cause you were a hot (but tasty) mess.
author: Alexa M.

description: my church had a slew of meetings, so after service, we ordered a ton of pizzas from North Beach. it was my first time trying their pizza, so i must say i was fairly impressed (...considering there's even a Domino's down the street from my church too). we ordered a good variety (pepperoni, cheese, hawaiian (my fav) and also some meat and some vegetable specialties), and each of them were still hot, had that nice gooey cheese and tasted like they used fresh ingredients. they have other locations throughout the City, but for me, it's definitely right up there with Seniore's.
author: Mike C.

description: Their pizza is a little more expensive than most places but I dont think its worth it. Big slices and decent quality but the cheese often falls off when i eat it. They are however one of the few places I know that serve the feta cheese topping.
author: Robert Y.

description:
Not bad, not bad.  The crust has a good flavor, the toppings are really good, if not abundant.  My only complaint was the lack of sauce.  They really need to be a bit more charitable with that stuff, I suppose next time I could ask for extra sauce and see what I get.

Otherwise, I'd eat there again.  It's a step up from Round Table.
author: Jonathan B.

description:
I tried to like this place, but I can't. The facility is pretty modern and clean, its just a take-out type of place (maybe they deliver, idk), with no seating.

Their pizza is just OK. I wouldnt call it bad or anything, but there is NOTHING above average about it. Its like this place is the low end of non-national-chain pizza.

The staff is really nice though.
author: Josh S.

description: ordered  a lrg north beach other nite & came really quivk, but it was tasteless, mind you said tasteless not salty, the ingredients ie: salami, peperoni wasall too salty, too many veggies filled the pie, making it taste like a veggie pie. they use to make very good pie's, not sure if cook changed or owner got cheap. all i can say better shop around before getting some pie from them, won't go back until i hear they've improved.
author: david c.

description:
Probably hands down the best crust I've ever had. Slices are just wow. Amazingly perfect portion. The flavors are definitely from flavortown. I'm a simple pizza eater. Pepperoni is my favorite topping. North Beach does it right by having crust, tomato sauce, cheese, pepperoni, then pile on more cheese. You say "excuse me I ordered pepperoni?" They say "take a bite". When you take a bite you realize oh snaps ninja pepperoni hidden under that cheese! Their pepperoni is not so tiny and puny but they are huge slices. They know what's up here. Their sausage topping is bomb diggity. I usually get pesto pepperoni. Their pesto is finger licking delicious. I've never personally had other pizzas except pepperoni, sausage, pesto, and "supreme". But the portion of this pizza is perfect and divine.

Just double park. Who cares. It's Taraval street. 

Prices are normal. $10-25 depending on what size and how many toppings you get. You could get a personal pizza for $6-7. 

The people are awesome. You could watch them make your pizza right in front of you if you order in person instead of calling ahead of time. It's awesome watching people make pizza. They bake it to perfect consistency that even you crust haters have to eat the crust. That's how frikkin good they are at North Beach.
author: Philbert K.

description: I like North Beach. The people who work here are very very nice. They make good conversation and keep you entertained while your pizza is being made. Service is fast and reliable. I haven't gotten delivery from here, but I might sooner or later. It's a good alternative to Brother's, since I've never gotten a tummy ache from North Beach.
author: Erica A.

description: S'okay. Nothing to rave about. Fast delivery and decent pizza. Twenty years ago, North Beach Pizza on Grant Ave. was the best pie in town. The franchise has never lived up to the original.
author: Patrick S.

description: I tried this place for the first time and I really really really liked it.  I got one of their new thin crust no sauce veggie pizzas and it was absolutely amazing - and I eat a lot of pizza around the city but this might be one of my absolute favorites.  The pizza came really fast and it was not greasy at all even though there was a generous amount of three different types of cheese on it and it tasted so amazingly fresh.  I haven't tried any of their other pizzas and I would have to say that their thin crust option was only medium thin - but I really really liked it and would definitely get it again.
author: Helga B.

description:
Delivery so fast it is at my door before I am done ordering.

Good above average pizza.
author: Shaun B.

description: The pizza is awesome! We always order a large half cheese and half American bacon with creamy garlic sauce. SO GOOD! I love me some bacon and they must know that cuz they always give me plenty. We of course get it delivered since we are too lazy to get up, put some pants on and drive over to get it. They always tell us it is going to take much longer than it really does.
author: John K.

description: they use multiple online ordering companies = confusion and them not receiving your order, do your self a favor stick with seniores
author: Wei W.

description: Nommmm! For new years we got some take out pizza,plain old cheese but scrumtious nonetheless. I usually order from their location on Mission though, and I think the one on Mission is much better. But if you live around here then definitely order!
author: Peeta B.

description: One of the better price ($3) to slice size (massive) ratios in the city.
author: Jason B.

description:
I like the Thick crust style Pizza and I'm NOT disappointed when I order A pie from North Beach and If you walk in they have Huge slices ready to go and at a good price.
A menu is a good thing to keep in "the Drawer"(of Menus)
author: Jeremiah A.

description: Workers were really nice (and hollered at me). But they were really helpful with my prom plans that dealt with using a pizza and M&Ms. I wouldve given them a perfect score if the pizza was cheaper. Chicken pesto is yum though, I must say.
author: Tee C.

description: Too heavy. If you can barely lift the pizza in the box when they deliver it, its bound to be a soggy, over piled mess of a pie. Sure enough, this was not my style of pizza.  I HATE wet pizza almost as much as I hate wet peanut butter.  The pizza was a half and half so they at least got 2 chances to impress me but nah. It was edible but disappointing because I could have sworn I enjoyed North Beach Pizza at another location a couple of years ago.The search for the best pizza delivery goes on.
author: Lisa J.

description:
I don't really feel nice giving only 2 stars, but my most recent experience with North Beach on Taraval was pretty bad. I'm not really judging this on their service or price (pretty cheap for a slice), but I am basing my rating on how terrible the pizza was. I ordered a slice of pepperoni pizza and was given in 2 minutes, a slice of cheese pizza with some odd salami like pepperoni about the size of a pickle jar lid placed on top. The meat was not even warm and the cheese didn't even melt and hold it in place. When I picked up the slice and folded it (sometimes I'm a folder) the "peperoni" popped off the pizza and that was it. I ended up either rearranging and placing the meat back on the slice or just eating single pieces of it. Kinda gross when it wasn't even hot.
I probably won't be coming back or ordering a pizza from here again...unless I'm at least buzzed and desperate for a quick bite for cheap.
author: Zach L.

description: i love North Beach pizza!  The Aloha Special (ham, canadian bacon and pineapple) is great.  Their italian sausage is really yummy, too.  i would guess that they make it themselves.  The best thing is that delivery is SUPER-FAST.  They'll tell you '30 to 45 minutes', but it is almost always closer to 30.
author: Eileen H.

description: The one thing that routinely makes me sick is greasy pizza. North Beach delivers great pizza without the gross, drippy stuff usually present in a lot of pies. I don't care for the pasta dishes...too salty and too much sauce. But the pepperoni and the Hawaiian...nice!
author: Virg Y.

description: I have not taken the time to visit one of these locations, but I have had food delivered from here.  Though I have not yet had the pizza either, the pasta dishes are quite enjoyable.  Delivery was quick and the food was still piping hot when it arrived.  One downside - they forgot to bring us the free grated cheese and pepper flakes that we asked for.  I have no doubt that I will be ordering from here again & again.
author: Victoria K.

description: Despite the reputation of other locations under the same trusted name, this place managed to churn out possibly the worst pepperoni pizza in recent history. I will never, ever, go back.
author: Ronan S.

description: This place is decent. I placed an order online for the Stanyan St location as the closest place to me. Not having received a confirmation about 10 minutes later I called and was informed my order had been auto-transferred to the Taraval location and it had already left to be delivered! No exaggeration ... these mugs were quick on the draw.
author: Todd F.

description: Expensive but good. The Golden Gate Special is pretty awesome. Crust is always good and the sauce is perfect, not too salty, not too sour, not too sweet.
author: Derrick L.

description:
Northbeach Pizza is actually filling, which is more than you can say for a lot of pizza places in San Francisco.  I can get pretty full off of 2-3 slices, so it's pretty good value-wise.

The crust is not too thick, not too thin -- a fine line to walk, and they get it just right.  Most importantly, the crust is not too chewy!  You don't get a sore jaw after eating here.  Sauce and toppings are generous, which is awesome.

There's no place to sit down inside, but I highly recommend this place for take-out or delivery.  Don't forget to try the New Mission Special pizza!  Barbecue sauce, chicken, bacon, mmm...
author: Ryan T.

description: The hispanic guys working here hoot and whistle at women passing by, as do most hispanic guys. I'm not being racist... ladies you know what I'm talking about! The workers didn't know my friend and I were actually going to walk INTO the place so the reaction and embarressment written all over their faces was priceless. This is part of the reason I now get my pizza delivered; garlic pesto chicken to be exact. My favorite kind of pizza from my favorite local pizza place. Try it. I'm sure you'll love it too :)
author: Jen Y.

description: I don't like the crust. The pizzas are okay... nothing special, so I pretty much have nothing to say.
author: Allyson L.

description: North Beach Pizza serves the Outer Sunset neighborhood pretty well; in an area wrought with Chinese Food restaurants, its something a little more "American" (or Italian).  The crust is extremely thick, but the cause is zesty and tasty.  I've only ordered slices here, which have been of varying degrees of freshness.  There are worse (and better) places for pizza, but this place will do the trick.
author: Matthew P.

description: I give them 4 stars cause I've gotten their pizza's delivered to me twice and they are always prompt. The pizza is delicious and hot. The garlic bread has a little too much garlic for my liking. I love the fact that they do a half and half if you want. This place is pretty awesome!
author: Rebecca T.

description: Like all the North Beach Pizza places...all the friggin topping come off the second you try to even grab a slice. flavor is ok..but its a complete mess.
author: Craig I.

description: Greasy, often inedible(depending on how drunk you are) west coast pizza. Only go if you absolutely have to. I rate this equal to Mr Pizzaman.
author: H K.

description: I live up the street from this place! It little, but the pizza is soo good! Especially the BBQ pizza!! The pice isn't too bad, and the coupons help out! I recommend anyone to this place! You won't want to go anywhere else!!
author: Elysha O.

description: Not the best pizza in the city, but their delivery service is down to a science. I actually don't mind the doughy crust. I've tried some of their pasta entrees and thought it was ok. The real draw is the pizza.
author: chip n. c.

description: Very good pizza ... I like it. Try their thin crust. Can order online too...the free buffalo wings not that good though.
author: Ringo L.
