description: i just dont know what happened here. i mean i like the fact that you could order online and also see your choices but the pizza and wings i ordered just wasnt good. we had the large half & half pizza-- half coit tower & half aloha. the coit tower had pepperoni, salami, sausage, and mushrooms. how can you go wrong with that? the aloha had canadian bacon, ham & pineapple. doesnt seem very difficult to put together either. i dont know what it really was. maybe the greasy-ness wasnt that mmm.. comfort food kind of greasy. the pizza dough was kind of tough and their chicken wings were dry. they didnt even come with ranch. i guess you have to pay extra for a dinky ranch container. BLAH time to wash that taste out with some beer. definately..
author: melanie t.

description: In the whole culinary Coast war there is one category in which the left will never be the best. And that category is pizza. If you are an east coast transplant, the quicker you come to terms with this fact the better off you will be. A few weekends ago I was visiting San Francisco and hosting some family and friends in my apartment-y vacation rental in the sunset. I had intended to cook for folks, but it had been a long day and by the time we got back to the place we were absolutely starved. The owner of the unit I was renting suggested North Beach Pizza and specifically the Pizza Verdi  which has spinach, pesto and white sauce to feed the group. I ordered two large pies. I must've been tired, and forgotten which coast I was on, because when I asked for the total after placing my order I internally gasped when I heard that it was fifty bucks.  Is this absolutely amazing pizza? No. And if you're from the east coast? Hell no. But it was delivered quickly, with the knock on our door occurring well before the promised time. And it was reasonably good pizza- not too greasy with an acceptable crust and decent topping distribution. But I second whomever it was that mentioned the lack of sauce. Good for lastminuteohgodI'msohungry grubbin, mmm hmmm.
author: Greycella L.

description: this place does no credit to the name "North Beach." though delivery was timely as there are more delivery guys waiting around the shop than there are cooks in the closet hole of a restaurant space (often taking parking spaces from residents and patrons of other establishments nearby), the pie is not worth the dough. my last taste from the chef left me wishing that i'd suck on a piece of charcoal instead. doughy thick, the ingredients may be right, but quantity-to-taste leaves much to be desired. order from any downtown North Beach and it's no comparison. tried the other offerings and don't want to say anything. ride up to "Seniore's Pizza" on 19th if you have a real craving.
author: marvin l.

description:
since it's so close, usually order from here because it's a quick 2 minute pick up. if we're reeeaaalllyy lazy, then delivery - and those guys are pretty cool and nice. always with the extra crushed peppers!! 

the golden gate (various meat selections) and half mushroom/olive (if i'm splitting with my sister) are our fave choices. 

i love the crust!
author: L B.

description: i honestly love their pizza here. i dont feel loaded up on grease after one of these. i always get their cable car special and the san francisco special simply amazing. their ingredients taste really fresh and i personally love their doughy crust. the only thing that marks them down is how expensive their pizzas are. also their wings aint that bad either.
author: austin c.

description: pizza took an hour for delivery and was ice cold, for the price you might as well get dominoes
author: cornelius u.

description: ok spot...  little pricey compared to places couple blocks away and better i think... brothers pizza that is...  anways...  it's ok...
author: Anthony Z.

description: Great Pizza!  Ask for it to be cooked light or they will leave it in the oven too long.  Pepperoni is too greasy but cheese and pineapple is awesome!  I order there once or twice a week.
author: kim h.

description: So this place is basically just good for togo food but it really is delicious. People say it's too greasy but it's pizza and I'm sure the greasiness is half of what makes it so delicious. Their slices are good and cheap. their pasta is decent but a bit messy to take home. Their salads are good and big for how cheap.
author: Jennifer S.

description: i really like North Beach Pizza, it was one of my favorite places to order from....until the other day i ordered chicken wings....i got them home and started eating them and to my surprise there were still FEATHERS on the wings!!!!!!!!!!! disgusting! i called the health department and reported them.....they just lost a customer, one who usually orders from the about 2x a week!
author: SFone D.

description: extremely greasy, i got an headache after eating their pizza.....not healthy for kids at all.
author: vsvb w.
